Senior Product Manager of AI and ML

At Udacity, our mission is to democratize education, providing aspiring learners around the world with access to affordable, technical education that enables students to master the needed skills to launch or advance their careers.

- Built the Galvanize Developer Evangelist role and the team- Hired and managed a distributed team of Developer Evangelists (covering SF, Seattle, NYC, Austin, Denver, Boulder and Phoenix). - Grew SF Data Science community from 3K to 12K - Project managed the creation and launch of the part-time class: DS Fundamentals, Intro to Python. This class is projected to yield between 1 and 3 million in revenue in 2016.- Contributed "student acquisition" strategy and tactics to new market launch playbook- Wrote Galvanize playbook for DS conference involvement and in-kind trades- Closed partnership with Name.com to provide free domain names to Galvanize students- Partnered with Strata Hadoop World, PyData, MLconf, Structure Data, H2o World, Turi's Data Science Summit, the Rich Data Summit, Gaming Analytics Summit, Machine Learning Innovation Summit, DataEng Conf, Lucene Revolution...

- Customer development and discovery- Quantitative and qualitative experiment design and analysis- Roadmap planning and feature prioritization- Usability studies (create test script, conduct test, product takeaways)- Email experiments (email digest, re-engagement campaigns, etc.)

- Broke the Denver  record for users acquired in a week (over 3K) and the record for lowest cost per acquisition (CPA) & cost per rider (CPR) in a week- Created system for using UTM parameters to track driver acquisition campaigns- Designed and implemented Driver Perks & Partnerships Program- Refactored and Managed Brand Ambassador Program (new training program, reduced cost, improved process)

Rafflecopter is the world's easiest way to run a giveaway online.- Customer development interviews- Qualitative survey design and analysis- In depth research into: online influencers and how they collaborate with brands- Created company content strategy and writing style guidelines- Funnel Visualization and Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO)- Created Company Standards for using UTM Parameters: http://blog.rafflecopter.com/2014/04/utm-naming-conventions/http://blog.rafflecopter.com/2014/04/utm-parameters-best-practices/- Partnerships- Planned and managed sponsorship of the Build Your Blog Conference: http://blog.rafflecopter.com/2014/02/blog-conference-takeaways/

Jared is a force of nature! As Galvanize's Director of Evangelism, he fired on all cylinders getting the word out about our education programs around the country.Whether he was hosting industry conferences and events that drew huge crowds, or publishing blog posts for mass consumption, Jared was an effective connector and communicator who bridged the gap for experts in the field and novices who were just becoming aware.

Lee Ngo
Educational Technology Community Architect
February 9, 2017, Lee reported directly to Jared

Jared was my de facto and eventual official leader during my first 18 months as an evangelist for Galvanize. Passionate, relentless, and erudite are the first three words that come to mind when I think of what Jared brought to a company which grew rapidly during his time and in large part by his efforts. He encouraged me to think big, shoot for the moon, outpace myself, yet also stop once in a while to appreciate what we have built together. I learned much through his camaraderie and mentoring, and I consider him both a solid addition to any company as well as a great friend.
